explanation: formal; exactly the opposite of someone or something or of each other
sentence: The idea that science is antithetical to the arts is wrong.
sentence_gap: The idea that science is ____________ to the arts is wrong.

explanation: a strip of plastic, wood, or metal with a row of long, narrow parts along one side, which is used to arrange or hold the hair
sentence: Combs have been used from ancient times by women to hold and fix their hair.
sentence_gap: _____ have been used from ancient times by women to hold and fix their hair.

explanation: an area of flat ground outside that is partly or completely surrounded by the walls of a building
sentence: Entrance to the apartment building is through a central courtyard.
sentence_gap: Entrance to the apartment building is through a central _________.

explanation: to stop doing something, especially something that someone else does not want you to do
sentence: The soldiers have been ordered to desist from firing their guns.
sentence_gap: The soldiers have been ordered to ______ from firing their guns.

explanation: (of a quality) which you are born with, or which is present naturally
sentence: Her dance expresses the innate beauty of the human spirit.
sentence_gap: Her dance expresses the ______ beauty of the human spirit.

explanation: any one of the eight least valuable pieces in the game of chess
sentence: The refugees are pawns in an international political dispute.
sentence_gap: The refugees are _____ in an international political dispute.

explanation: a poisonous snake found in southern parts of the US that, when annoyed, produces a loud noise by shaking its tail
sentence: A huge rattlesnake lay coiled on the blanket.
sentence_gap: A huge ___________ lay coiled on the blanket.

explanation: formal; a main road for public use or a passage through somewhere
sentence: The property was located at the intersection of two busy thoroughfares.
sentence_gap: The property was located at the intersection of two busy _____________.

explanation: under your feet; on the ground where you are walking
sentence: The grass was cool and pleasant underfoot. I was nearly trampled underfoot by the crowd of people rushing for the door.
sentence_gap: The grass was cool and pleasant _________. I was nearly trampled _________ by the crowd of people rushing for the door.

explanation: the special clothes worn by priests during church ceremonies
sentence: His meals were always ready, his clothes clean and pressed, and his vestments for the Sunday service were immaculate.
sentence_gap: His meals were always ready, his clothes clean and pressed, and his _________ for the Sunday service were immaculate.
